As a member of the PACA Commonwealth, the regional governor of Hu?nuco, Juan Alvarado Cornelio, referred to the importance of the unification of the regions to achieve decentralization and make the work of the central highway a reality, "we who are in the central region of the country we are satisfied with this project because it will now allow the reactivation of various sectors in our regions, it will allow the reduction of hours and flow of shipments, let's make a great Peru that unites, works and defends, because we are a country of all bloods ", he added.

In said meeting, it was learned that the project will benefit 3 provinces (Lima, Huarochir? and Yauli), allowing the road integration of the Jun?n, Pasco, Hu?nuco, Ucayali and San Mart?n regions, as well as the southern regions such as Ayacucho, Apur?mac and Cuzco.

The project aims to improve the quality of life of the population in the affected areas, providing security and tranquility, avoiding long-distance traffic, increasing their productivity and ensuring that resources easily reach the markets, reducing travel time. , among others.

In the case of the department of Hu?nuco, according to the studies presented, it has greater agricultural potential, whose production is destined for local, national and foreign markets, but the current state of passability of the central highway raises transportation costs and losses in production due to time that the transfer is worth, making agriculture less competitive, and with a new highway, greater economic movement will be generated.
